Which of the following sets of data provides evidence that best supports common ancestry for organisms in all three domains?

choices.label: There are autotrophic and heterotrophic organisms found in Bacteria, Archaea, and Eukarya.
There is a progression of pathways in organisms found in Bacteria, Archaea, and Eukarya.

Organisms in Bacteria, Archaea, and Eukarya each have adenine, thymine, guanine, and cytosine bases forming their <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
There is a progression of cellular organization in organisms found in Bacteria, Archaea, and Eukarya.

content.answer: Organisms in Bacteria, Archaea, and Eukarya each have adenine, thymine, guanine, and cytosine bases forming their <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
